member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for reading configuration settings in the user's project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConfigHelper class.
member.param: The IVsHierarchy of the project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper.IsPrefixUsedInAppSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an appSetting key exists with the specified keyPrefix.
member.param: The prefix string to check for.
member.returns: true if an appSetting already exists that has a key starting with the keyPrefix; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
member.param: A value that indicates whether this object is being disposed or finalized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConfigHelper.Configuration
member.summary: The Configuration object that can be used to inspect the configuration settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServicesUtilities.GetProjectFullPath(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.String)
member.summary: Get an absolute path for a file that is in the project structure.
member.param: The parent project hierarchy object.
The filename to convert to an absolute path.
member.returns: Returns an absolute path for a file that is in the project structure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.Curator.GetHelper(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Gets the handler helper for the given project.
member.param: The project context.
member.returns: Returns the project-specific handler helper.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.Curator.AllHandlerHelpers
member.summary: Gets the complete (unfiltered) list of handler helpers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.EditableConfigHelper
member.summary:
Provides methods for setting configuration settings in the user's project.
The Save method must be called to save any changes.
member.remarks: This class does not preserve whitespace in the appSettings section.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.EditableConfigHelper.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EditableConfigHelper class.
member.param: The IVsHierarchy of the project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.EditableConfigHelper.Save
member.summary: Writes the configuration settings contained within this System.Configuration.Configuration object to the current XML configuration file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.EditableConfigHelper.SetAppSetting(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Ensures there is a key-value pair in the appSettings config section with the specified key and value.
member.param: The key of the app setting.
The value of the app setting.
An optional xml comment to add before the app setting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities
member.summary: This class contains methods that are useful for error checking and validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.VerifyThrowArgumentNull(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentNullException using the given parameter name if value is null.
member.param: The value to verify.
Name of the argument that is being verified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.VerifyThrowArgumentNull(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentNullException using the given parameter name if value is null or empty.
member.param: The value to verify.
Name of the argument that is being verified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.VerifyThrowArgumentException(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentException.
member.param: The condition to verify. Throw if condition is false.
The argument that is being verified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.VerifyThrowArgumentOutOfRange(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentOutOfRangeException using the given parameter name if the condition is false.
member.param: The condition to verify.
The argument that is being verified.
Additional message to add to the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.ThrowArgumentNull(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentNullException.
member.param: The name of the argument that is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.ThrowArgumentException(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentException.
member.param: The name of the argument that is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.ThrowArgumentOutOfRange(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an argument out of range exception.
member.param: The name of the argument that is out of range.
Additional message to add to the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ErrorUtilities.IsCriticalException(System.Exception)
member.summary: If the given exception is "ignorable under some circumstances" return false. Otherwise it's "really bad", and return true. This makes it possible to catch(Exception ex) without catching disasters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper
member.summary: A class that contains helper methods that IConnectedServiceInstanceHandler implementations commonly use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper.AddAssemblyReference(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a reference to the specified assembly to the project.
member.param: Specifies the context where the assembly reference should be added.
The assembly to which to add a reference. This can be specified either as a simple .NET Framework object name, such as "System.Web", or as a .NET Framework file name, such as "C:\path\program.dll".
member.exception: Thrown when the assembly reference is not successfully added to the project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper.AddFileAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add the specified file to the project after doing token replacement.
member.param: Specifies the context where the file should be added.
The file to copy and add to the project.
The project relative filename where the file should be added.
A dictionary of key/value pairs that can be used to insert runtime values into the file that needs to be added to the project.
A value indicating whether the file should be opened after being added.
member.returns: Returns the path to the file that was added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper.AddGettingStartedAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Adds the getting started artifact to the project and launches the page in the browser.
member.param: The context containing service instance information.
The name of the folder where the service artifacts are stored. This is a subfolder of the Service References folder.
The Uri for the getting started page.
member.returns: Returns a Task that can be waited on to be notified when the getting started page has been added to the project and opened in the browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper.GetServiceArtifactsRootFolder(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext)
member.summary: Gets the name of the root folder to place the service related artifacts in. Typcially each provider instance should create its own subfolder under this root folder.
member.param: The context containing service instance information.
member.returns: The name of the root folder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelper.PerformTokenReplacement(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Given an input, replace any tokens found in the specified dictionary with the specified values.
member.param: The context containing service instance information.
The text to update.
A dictionary of keys to search for and values to replace the keys with.
member.returns: Returns a new string with the tokens replace with the values from the specified dictionary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.CommonConnectedServiceHandlerHelper.CopyAndPerformTokenReplacementAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Copy fileToCopy and perform token replacement on the newly copied file, keeping fileToCopy unchanged.
member.param: The context that contains the replacement dictionary.
The source file.
The filename to use for the saved file.
A dictionary of key/value pairs that can be used to insert runtime values into the file that needs to be added to the project.
member.returns: Returns a task that can be awaited on and get the path to the newly created file.
member.remarks: The file will be created in the temp directory after token replacement but will have the correct target name. This allows the caller to add the file to the project without having to worry about the renaming step.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.IVsTextLinesExtensions.MaxLineLengthToConsider
member.summary: We set an arbitrary limit on the line length that we're willing to handle. This is to avoid loading an unreasonably long string into memory. The buffer is compressed under the covers, so it can handle much longer strings.

member.param: The buffer to enumerate.
The starting index, inclusive.
The end index, exclusive.
member.returns: Returns an enumrator that will enumerate over the lines [startIndex, endIndex) of the buffer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementMethodAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that can be applied to a method to signal that it can be used as a Token Replacement method.
member.remarks: The method is required to only have one parameter of type string and the return value must be of type string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder
member.summary: Build a new string based on replacement parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.AddDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}})
member.summary: Add a dictionary of replacement tokens to consider when performing token replacement.
member.param: The set of key/value pairs that can be used as token values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.Build(System.String)
member.summary: Build a new string based on replacement parameters.
member.param: The input to use as a template.
member.returns: Returns a new string with the tokens replacement.
member.remarks: If a token or method is not recognized, the token is left unaltered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.GetMethods
member.summary: Get a list of methods supported for token replacement methods.
member.returns: Returns a dictionary of methods where the key is the case-insensitive method name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.TryEvaluateToken(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Try to get the value for a token (e.g., $TokenName$ or $Method(TokenName)$).
member.param: The token to evaluate.
The token value result.
member.returns: Returns true if the token is recognized and evaluated; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.TryEvaluateMethod(System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Call a method with the token value as a parameter.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the method to call.
The parameter to the method.
If the method succeeds, result is the value returned from the method or null if the method failed or was not recognized.
member.returns: Returns true if the method was executed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.MakeSafeIdentifierName(System.String)
member.summary: Given a value, ensure that only ascii A-Z and number 0-9 and '_' are part of the token value. Any other values are replaced with '_'.
member.param: The token value to normalize.
member.returns: Returns a safe string version of the token value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.MakeSafeFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Given a value, ensure that only valid filename characters are part of the token value. Any other values are replaced with '_'.
member.param: The token value to normalize.
member.returns: Returns a safe string version of the token value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.HandlerHelpers.TokenReplacementBuilder.MakeSafeDirectoryName(System.String)
member.summary: Given a value, ensure that only valid directory name characters are part of the token value. Any other values are replaced with '_'.
member.param: The token value to normalize.
member.returns: Returns a safe string version of the token value.

The name of the folder to add.
member.returns: Returns the ProjectItems of the newly created folder.

member.summary: Add the file to the ProjectItems.
member.param: The item under which to add the file.
The source filename.
The target filename.
member.returns: Returns the newly added project item.
member.remarks: AddFromFileCopy assumes that the file does not exist on disk already.

member.summary: Raises the System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized event. This method is invoked whenever System.Windows.FrameworkElement.IsInitialized is set to true internally.
member.param: The System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.Controls.ObjectPicker.Categories
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of ObjectPickerCategory objects to display in the ObjectPicker.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.Controls.ObjectPicker.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message that occurred while constructing the objects to display in the ObjectPicker. This error message gets displayed within the ObjectPicker as a means to indicate to the end user what the issue was that prevented the objects from being displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.Controls.VirtualToggleButton
member.summary: Represents a virtual toggle button. This is used when it is necessary for non-toggleable control (e.g TreeViewItem) to behave like a toggle buttons.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to add reference to {0}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed saving the {0} user settings. {1}.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.UserSettingsHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for loading and saving user settings from isolated storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.UserSettingsHelper.Save(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Saves user settings to isolated storage. The data is stored with the user's roaming profile.
member.param: The user settings to be saved. A DataContractSerializer is used to store the data, so this object must specify a System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute.
The ProviderId of the Connected Service Provider invoking this method.
A unique name for the user settings being saved. If an isolated storage file for the current user exists for the specified providerId and name, it will be overwritten with the specified userSettings.
An optional delegate which, if specified, will be executed immediately after a successful save operation.
member.remarks: Non-critical exceptions are handled by writing an error message in the output window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.UserSettingsHelper.Load``1(System.String,System.String,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Loads user settings from isolated storage.
member.typeparam: The type of the userSettings to load. A DataContractSerializer is used to store the data, so this type must specify a System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute.
member.param: The ProviderId of the Connected Service Provider invoking this method.
The name of the user settings to be loaded.
An optional delegate which, if specified, will be executed immediately after a successful load operation.
member.returns: The specified user settings if they exist; else returns null.
member.remarks: Non-critical exceptions are handled by writing an error message in the output window and returning null.
